moves.1. e4 Nf6: The Alekhine Defense. I love this defense as white has to make a choice of chasing down the knight or proper development.
moves.2. e5 Nd5 3. c4: I usually see d4 or Nf3 here, but this move is perfectly playable.
moves.3... Nb6 4. d4: We are now out of book but this move doesn't seem bad. Gameknot says that c5 or b3 were better options.
moves.4... d6: Black always wants to disrupt white's central pawns in the Alekhine defense.
moves.5. c5: This is where I think White goes to far with his pawns. They are way to far up with nothing really supporting them.
moves.5... Nd5: 5... dxc 6. dxc Qxd1 7. Kxd1 I looked at but I liked this move as white is done chasing my knight around.
moves.6. Nc3: finally some minor piece development on move 6.
moves.6... Be6 7. Nf3 g6 8. Bc4: There is a lot of pressure in the middle, and all hell is about to break loose.
After 3 exchanges, all is even but white's position looks open and my queen and bishop are threatening to do some damage.
moves.12... Nc6: I wanted that d pawn and no one was going to stop me from getting it.
moves.13. Be3 O-O-O: I have 4 attackers on that pawn, and white can only muster 3 defenders, so that pawn will drop.
moves.14. O-O Nxd4 15. Nxd4 Bxd4 16. Bxd4 Qxd4: and white decides to keep his queen while also protecting that c pawn.
moves.17... Rd5 18. Rfd1: Better I think was Rac1 to save the pawn
moves.19... Rhd8: If i take with the rook I lose tempo and control of the open file. Let him come to me.
moves.20. Rxd5 Qxd5 21. h3: Protecting and thoughts of a back rank mate.
moves.22. Qa3: Of course not and his queen is threatening my e7 pawn.
moves.22... e6: I was wary of this move, because eventually his queen was going to go to e7 and cause my pawns trouble, but I feel I can defend against it.
moves.25. Qf6 Qe8 26. Qf4 f5: I completely missed the threat on f7 again, whoops.
moves.28... a6: give my king some breathing room.
moves.29. Rc7 Qb5: protecting against an assault on b7. Maybe I can hold out.
moves.30. b3 Qb6: His queen can't take on g6 or my queen will take his rook.
moves.31. Rc2: A blunder that ends the game I believe.
moves.34. g4:
I think f3 would have been better. Sure it drops the pawn but his rook would have been able to move in. I think he wanted an escape to h4 with his king if I played Rh1+ or Qh1+. 
g4 loses a rook.
moves.35... Qe4+: There is no way to save the rook and my opponent resigned. I hope you guys enjoyed and please leave feedback.
